column4: Can somebody please point me to a good article on Window Managers? KDE and GNOME and desktops. KDE has kwm, GNOME has ... (?). Can KDE be used with a different manager or will is not be KDE any longer? Same for GNOME. What is the difference between WMs? Within GNOME you can customize panels and window dressings. What is different about different WMs besides what can be controlled by themes?
your asking a big question :)
I know. I am big...
I tried RTFM but can't find much
but this is a gret site: http://xwinman.org/
I understand what GNOME and KDE are (I think). They include libraries for interfacing with X (Qt and GTK) and sets of tools (like arts vs. ESD, etc)
gives you an overview of most wm available for X.
I found this one. It does not answer my question though, what is the difference? I mean there are screenshots...
And there are themes for each WM (that don't work on other WMs)
most wm's have their own unike themes
Right. But do I choose WM just by the themes I like?!
but *box wm's are (sometimes) compatible
you can use gnome or kde with different wm's, if you really want to...
I got that. What I don't understand is why would I want to :) Just for themes?
Ok, some want themes, some want features, some want to be cool.... many reasons to switch wm.
kde =kwin, gnome=metacit
I don't think I want themes. What features are different?
unless you have a reason to swich wm, I wouldn't bother...
Well, I want to understand what I am working with
Despite sounding like a complete newb I do have some exp and I want to have more
wm are as diffent as cars: looks, handling, performance, image, everything
